questions.question: A security administrator adds a firewall rule that blocks inbound traffic to an internal management interface from the internet. Which option BEST classifies this control?
questions.explanation: The rule blocks access before an attacker can reach the interface (preventive), and it is implemented through a firewall configuration (technical).

questions.question: A company requires all employees to complete annual security awareness training on handling sensitive information. Which control category BEST fits this requirement?
questions.explanation: Training is carried out by people as part of routine operations, so it is an operational control (category). Preventive is a type, not a category.

questions.question: A sign on a server room door reads “Authorized Personnel Only,” but there is no lock. What control type BEST describes the sign?
questions.explanation: The sign directs user behavior toward a secure action but does not enforce it, making it a directive control.

questions.question: A security team reviews authentication logs each day and investigates unusual login patterns. What control type BEST describes the daily log review?
questions.explanation: Reviewing logs is intended to discover and alert on suspicious activity, which is the purpose of a detective control.

questions.question: A critical application has a known vulnerability, but the vendor patch will not be available for two weeks. The team temporarily restricts access using network segmentation rules. What control type BEST describes the segmentation rule in this scenario?
questions.explanation: Because the primary fix (patching) is not available yet, the segmentation rule serves as an alternate temporary measure—a compensating control.
